translations.translation: You are calling them to a straight path.
You are surely calling them to the right path.
You are calling them to a Straight Way,
(Muhammad), you certainly have called them to the right path,
And indeed you call them to the Straight Path.
And certainly, you call them to the straight path.
And most surely you invite them to a right way.
Assuredly thou art calling them to a straight path;
And lo! thou summonest them indeed unto a straight path.
and, most surely, you are calling them to a straight path.
And verily thou! thou callest them unto a Path straight.
Indeed you invite them to a straight path,
But verily thou callest them to the Straight Way;
And certainly, you (O Muhammad SAW) call them to a Straight Path (true religion Islamic Monotheism).
Indeed you are calling them to a Straight Path,
You are inviting them to a straight path.
And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.
[23:73] And truly you summon them to a straight path, a [straight] route, that is, the religion of Islam.
(And lo! thou) Muhammad (summonest them indeed unto a right path) to an established religion which Allah is pleased with: Islam.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ وَ } بالجملة: هم منحرفون في أنفسهم عن جادة التوحيد؛ بحيث لا يفيدهم هدايتكم وإرشادك { إِنَّكَ } بوحي الله إياك { لَتَدْعُوهُمْ } وتهديهم




{ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ } [المؤمنون: 73] سويٍّ لا عوجَ له أصلاً، وهو طريق التوحيد الذاتي

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { وإنك لتدعوهم إلى صراط مستقيم } تشهد العقول السليمة باستقامته، ليس فيه شائبة اعوجاج، توجب اتهامهم لك بوجه من الوجوه، ولقد ألزمهم الله - تعالى - الحجة، وأزاح عِللهم في هذه الآيات، حيث حصر أقسام ما يؤدي إلى الإنكار والاتهام من قوله: { أم لم يعرفوا رسولهم
